abstract: African Union's peace and security council calls on Nigeria, Benin, Cameroon, Chad and Niger to prevent expansion of Boko Haram; stops short of authorizing cross-border operations.
lead_paragraph: Troops from Chad led the recapture of a town from Boko Haram, and the African Union called for the creation of a 7,500-member regional force.

byline.contributor: Somini Sengupta reported from the United Nations, and Adam Nossiter from Maiduguri, Nigeria.
byline.original: By SOMINI SENGUPTA and ADAM NOSSITER

snippet: Troops from Chad led the recapture of a town from Boko Haram, and the African Union called for the creation of a 7,500-member regional force.

headline.main: African Nations Show Progress in Uniting to Beat Back Militants in Nigeria
headline.print_headline: African Nations Show Progress in Uniting to Beat Back Militants in Nigeria
